column2: FLORIDA DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: Florida
column6: FL

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. The Florida “standard” speed limits in municipal speed areas is:
column4: 25 MPH.
column6: 55 MPH.
column8: 30 MPH.

column2: 2. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column6: another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column8: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column10: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.

column2: 3. The picture shows:
column4: a flashing arrow panel.
column6: a sharp curve sign.
column8: a one way sign.

column2: 4. Parking is allowed:
column4: within intersections.
column6: on crosswalks.
column8: on public roads.
column10: within 15 feet of a fire hydrant.

column2: 5. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.
column6: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.
column8: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.

column2: 6. Braking distance is:
column4: usually 50 feet.
column6: how far a vehicle will travel, in ideal conditions, while the driver is braking.
column8: the total distance a vehicle has traveled until it comes to a complete stop.
column10: how far a vehicle will continue to travel before the driver hits the brakes.

column2: 7. Which of the following is NOT defensive driving:
column4: Looking for possible danger.
column6: Acting right away to prevent a crash.
column8: Thinking ahead.

column2: 8. This sign means:
column4: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.
column6: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.
column8: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.
column10: The recommended speed limit is 45 MPH.

column2: 9. Driving 16 MPH or more over lawful or posted speed will result in __ points being added.
10. On a highway, you are moving in the opposite direction of a stopped school bus which is picking up or dropping off children. You:
column4: can pass the bus.
column6: must always stop.
column8: must stop if the bus’ stop arm is withdrawn.
column10: do not have to stop if the highway is divided by a raised barrier or an unpaved median at least five feet wide.

column2: 11. Which of the following is true? Your license will be SUSPENDED:
column4: if you are found guilty of racing on the highway.
column6: if you commit retail theft.
column8: if you park next to a fire hydrant.

column2: 12. A driver is approaching a highway-railroad crossings and is following a bus. The driver should:
column4: pass the bus and come to a complete stop within 15 feet of the crossing.
column6: be alert as the bus may have to stop at the crossing even when the gates are up.
column8: overtake and pass the bus before reaching the crossing.

column2: 13. Which line on a pavement permits the passing of other vehicles?
column4: Solid yellow line.
column6: Broken yellow line
column8: Broken white line

column2: 14. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.
column6: look well down the road and far off to each side.
column8: Slow down when approaching animals that are standing near the road.

column2: 15. Which of the following is true when crossing a railroad track:
column4: Do not move forward until it's safe to do so.
column6: If there is more than one track, make sure all tracks are clear before starting to cross.
column8: In heavy traffic, make sure there is room for their vehicle on the other side before crossing.

column2: 16. This road sign means:
column4: Left turns are not allowed where this sign is displayed.
column6: Sharp turn ahead.
column8: Vehicles turning left must make a U-turn.
column10: Drivers cannot make a complete turn to go in the opposite direction.

column2: 17. Parking is not allowed within __ feet of a railroad crossing.
18. This sign indicates:
column4: Emergency line available
column6: Cell phone shop ahead
column8: Do not use your phone while driving

column2: 19. Car pool vehicles are those with:
column4: 2 or more occupants in the car.
column6: 3 or more occupants in the car.
column8: less than 4 occupants in the car.

column2: 20. In Florida, bicyclists on public roads have the same rights and responsibilities as:
column4: sidewalk riders.
column6: drivers of motorized vehicles.
column8: pedestrians on sidewalks and in crosswalks.

column2: 21. If traffic signals are out of order, drivers must:
column4: treat the light as if it is a four-way stop sign.
column6: treat the light as if it is a yellow light.
column8: stop if they can.
column10: treat the light as if it is a green light.

column2: 22. The ‘One Way’ sign means that:
column4: there is only one road that turns left at the intersection.
column6: only vehicles turning left may travel in the direction of the arrow.
column8: drivers may travel only in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 23. When a school bus stops to unload children on a divided highway, should the vehicles traveling in the same direction as the bus stop?
column4: No, only vehicles traveling in the opposite direction have to stop.
column6: Yes, if you are in a school zone.
column8: Yes, always.
column10: Stopping is optional in this specific case.

column2: 24. On an expressway, drivers should:
column4: follow other vehicles closely.
column6: drive on the median strip.
column8: park on the left lane.
column10: stop driving when they feel tired.

column2: 25. The picture shows:
column4: a reversible road with reserved lanes.
column6: a divided highway with a shared lane.
column8: a highway with a reversible lane.
column10: a two-way roadway with a center lane for left turns.

column2: 26. Your red traffic signal changes to green while a pedestrian is crossing in your traffic lane. The right of way should be given:
column4: to the pedestrian.
column6: by the pedestrian.
column8: to you.
column10: by the pedestrian, but only when vehicles are turning left.

column2: 27. The Financial Responsibility Law requires drivers to:
column4: be financially responsible for damages they may cause to others when a motor vehicle crash happens.
column6: pay $15,000 of Property Damage Liability (PDL)
column8: share the financial risk of road crashes with the other drivers

column2: 28. Drivers should keep a minimum following distance of:
column4: 3 to 4 seconds, with an additional second for any unusual weather or traffic conditions.
column6: 1 second, with an additional second when approaching an intersection.
column8: 55 milliseconds, with an additional millisecond for every drop of rain in a 2 miles radius.
column10: 1 to 2 seconds, with an additional second for any vehicle in front of them.

column2: 29. Which of the following is NOT true? Before you start your engine you should:
column4: make sure your safety belt is clean.
column6: adjust the seat so you can reach all controls.
column8: make sure your car is in park or neutral gear.
column10: adjust the inside and outside rearview mirrors.

column2: 30. Parking is not allowed within __ feet of any flashing signal, stop sign or traffic signal.
31. When the light is red, drivers:
column4: must stop after entering the intesection.
column6: must yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column8: must come to a complete stop before moving into the intersection.
column10: can go, but only if the intersection is clear.

column2: 32. Passing is allowed:
column4: at intersections
column6: on hills
column8: on two-lane highways

column2: 33. Before pulling out from a right-side parallel parking space, drivers must:
column4: check for approaching traffic and give a left turn signal.
column6: enter the traffic flow and then give a left turn signal.
column8: make sure no law enforcement officer who is directing traffic.

column2: 34. If you want to go to a social event where you might drink alcohol, you should:
column4: arrange to go with two or more people and agree that one of you will not drink alcohol.
column6: arrange to remain overnight or ride home with a friend who does not drink.
column8: use public transportation or a taxi, if available.

column2: 35. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: come to a complete stop.
column6: reduce the reaction distance.
column8: leave more space in front of their vehicle.
column10: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column2: 36. What is the meaning of red traffic signs?
column4: High emphasis warning.
column6: School ahead.
column8: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.

column2: 37. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a double curve ahead.
column6: they must turn either to the right or left.
column8: there is a winding road ahead.

column2: 38. Any driver under the age of 18 who accumulates six or more points within a 12 month period is automatically restricted for one year to:
column4: operating the motor vehicle only between 7:00 a.m. and 11:00 p.m.
column6: driving for “Business Purposes ONLY”.
column8: driving within 25 miles from home.

column2: 39. Crossbuck signs are:
column4: speed limit signs.
column6: yield signs.
column8: stop signs.

column2: 40. A bicyclist on the road ahead has their left arm extended downward to their left. You should assume the bicyclist is signaling that he/she is:
column4: turning left.
column6: about to turn right.
column8: slowing down or stopping.

column2: 41. Which of the following is NOT true? When you enter an open intersection, you must yield the right-of-way if:
column4: the traffic light is red.
column6: a vehicle is already in the intersection.
column8: you plan to make a left turn and a vehicle is approaching from the opposite direction.

column2: 42. A large percentage of motorist bicycle crashes occur:
column4: on interstate highways.
column6: at intersections.
column8: because there are too many byciclists.

column2: 43. Passengers under the age of 18:
column4: must always be restrained by a safety belt or a child restraint device.
column6: must be restrained by a safety belt or a child restraint device when seating in front.
column8: do not have to be restrained by a safety belt or a child restraint device.

column2: 44. An eight-lane highway has ________ pedestrian countdown period ___ a four-lane road.
column4: the same; as
column6: a longer; than
column8: half the; of

column2: 45. The picture shows:
column4: a three-point turn.
column6: that car number 1 should yield to car number 2, while car number 2 should yield to car number 3.
column8: a U-turn.

column2: 46. Unlawful speed resulting in a crash will result in __ points being added.
47. A second refusal to take a blood or breath test will result in:
column4: a fine of $1,500.
column6: an 18 month suspension and a first degree misdemeanor.
column8: a fine of $1,000.
column10: a 12 month suspension and a second degree misdemeanor.

column2: 48. At intersections marked with stop lines, drivers must:
column4: stop behind the lines and yield the right-of-way to all other traffic and pedestrians at stop signs.
column6: stop only if a pedestrian is crossing the road.
column8: yield the right-of-way to other vehicles and pedestrians and then stop.
column10: enter the intersection and then yield to pedestrians.

column2: 49. At 50 MPH, a vehicle will travel a minimum of ___ feet before the driver can bring it to a complete stop.
50. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you are not allowed to park here.
column6: you must display a special permit in order to park here.
column8: you must park your car between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column10: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.
